html:
Fujifilm has announced its first fixed lens, medium format camera, the GFX100RF which is very compact, portable and the lightest of the GFX model cameras. It comes with a 102 megapixel sensor and Fujifilm's X-Processor which is designed to have brilliant autofocus and low light performance. The fixed Fujinon lens is a 35mm f/4 lens.

This rangefinder style camera is made of lightweight aluminum, has analog controls and versatile aspect ratios. It has a quiet shutter and the aspect ratio dial allows the photographer to quickly choose between the nine available options. The camera also comes with improved AF tracking features.

Here are some of the key features of the Fujifilm GFX100RF:

  • 43.8mm×32.9mm GFX 102MP CMOS II sensor with primary color filter
  • 102 million pixels
  • FUJINON single focal length lens 35mm f/4 (35mm format equivalent : 28mm)
  • Lens elements – 10 elements in 8 groups
  • Aperture – F4 – F22, 9 blade aperture
  • Digital teleconverter – 45mm, 63mm, 80mm
  • Shoe mount flash
  • Electronic view finder
  • 3.15 inch Tilt-Type Touch Screen Color LCD Monitor
  • Interval Timer Shooting
  • 20 film simulation modes
  • Weather resistant
  • Weight approximately 735g

Besides the above features, the camera comes with a few accessories like an adapter ring that makes the camera weather-resistant when combined with filters, a high quality strap, an aluminum lens hood and a protective 4 stops ND filter.
